dublin_core.dcvalue: E mental health and m mental health include the use of technology in the prevention treatment and aftercare of mental health problems With the economical pressure on mental health services increasing e mental health and m mental health could bridge treatment gaps reduce waiting times for patients and deliver interventions at lower costs However despite the existence of numerous effective interventions the transition of computerised interventions into care is slow The aim of the present study was to investigate the acceptability of e mental health and m mental health in the general population
Made available in DSpace on 2020-02-07T13:36:51Z (GMT). No. of bitstreams: 0 Previous issue date: 2014-04-28
Understanding the acceptability of e-mental health--attitudes and expectations towards computerised self-help treatments for mental health problems.
